00025 void NonmemTranslator::parseIndAnalysis( const DOMElement* ind_analysis )
00026 {
00027   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00028   // Parse <simulate> if exists.  There's a chance in which only data simulation
00029   // is requested but not estimation.
00030   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00031   myIsSimulate = false;
00032   mySeed = 0;
00033   DOMNodeList * simulations = ind_analysis->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_SIMULATION );
00034   if( simulations->getLength() > 0 )
00035     {
00036       if( simulations->getLength() > 1 )
00037     {
00038       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00039       snprintf( mess, 
00040             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00041             "Multiple <%s> elements found.",
00042             XML.C_SIMULATION );
00043       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00044       throw e;
00045     }
00046       if( simulations->getLength() < 1 )
00047     {
00048       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00049       snprintf( mess, 
00050             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00051             "Missing <%s> element.",
00052             XML.C_SIMULATION );
00053       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00054       throw e;
00055     }
00056       myIsSimulate = true;
00057       DOMElement* simulation = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( simulations->item(0) );
00058       if( !simulation->hasAttribute( XML.X_SEED ) )
00059     {
00060       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00061       snprintf( mess, 
00062             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00063             "Missing <%s::%s> attribute.",
00064             XML.C_SIMULATION, XML.C_SEED );
00065       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00066       throw e;
00067     }
00068       const XMLCh* xml_seed = simulation->getAttribute( XML.X_SEED );
00069       if( !XMLString::textToBin( xml_seed, mySeed ) )
00070     {
00071           char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00072       snprintf( mess, 
00073             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00074             "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".", 
00075             XML.C_SIMULATION, XML.C_SEED, XMLString::transcode( xml_seed ) );
00076           SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00077           throw e;
00078     }
00079    
00080       if( simulation->hasAttribute( XML.X_SUBPROBLEMS ) )
00081     {
00082       const XMLCh* xml_subproblems = simulation->getAttribute( XML.X_SUBPROBLEMS );
00083       if( !XMLString::textToBin( xml_subproblems, mySubproblemsN ) )
00084         {
00085           char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00086           snprintf( mess, 
00087             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00088             "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".", 
00089             XML.C_SIMULATION, XML.C_SUBPROBLEMS, XMLString::transcode(xml_subproblems) );
00090           SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00091           throw e;
00092         }
00093     }
00094     }
00095 
00096   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00097   // <pop_analysis> Required attributes
00098   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00099   // * is_estimation = {yes, no}
00100   if( !ind_analysis->hasAttribute( XML.X_IS_ESTIMATION ) )
00101     {
00102       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00103       snprintf( mess, 
00104         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00105         "Missing <%s::%s> attribute.", 
00106         XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS, XML.C_IS_ESTIMATION );
00107       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00108       throw e;
00109     }
00110 
00111   const XMLCh * xml_is_estimation = ind_analysis->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_ESTIMATION );
00112   if( XMLString::equals( xml_is_estimation, XML.X_YES ) )
00113     myIsEstimate = true;
00114   else if ( XMLString::equals( xml_is_estimation, XML.X_NO ) )
00115     myIsEstimate = false;
00116   else
00117     {
00118       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00119       snprintf( mess,
00120         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00121            "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".", 
00122            XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS, 
00123            XML.C_IS_ESTIMATION, 
00124            XMLString::transcode( xml_is_estimation ) );
00125       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00126       throw e;
00127     }
00128 
00129   // * is_identifiability = {yes, no}
00130   //
00131   // Note that because of backwards compatability this attribute is optional.
00132   if( !ind_analysis->hasAttribute( XML.X_IS_IDENTIFIABILITY ) )
00133     {
00134       myIsIdent = false;
00135     }
00136   else
00137     {
00138       const XMLCh * xml_is_identifiability = ind_analysis->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_IDENTIFIABILITY );
00139       if( XMLString::equals( xml_is_identifiability, XML.X_YES ) )
00140         myIsIdent    = true;
00141       else if ( XMLString::equals( xml_is_identifiability, XML.X_NO ) )
00142         myIsIdent = false;
00143       else
00144         {
00145           char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00146           snprintf( mess,
00147             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00148                "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".", 
00149                XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS, 
00150                XML.C_IS_IDENTIFIABILITY, 
00151                XMLString::transcode( xml_is_identifiability ) );
00152           SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00153           throw e;
00154         }
00155     }
00156 
00157   if( myIsEstimate && myIsIdent )
00158     {
00159       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00160       snprintf( mess, 
00161         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00162         "Individual estimation and identifiability cannot be requested simultaneously." );
00163       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00164       throw e;
00165     }
00166 
00167   setPopSize( 1 );
00168 
00169   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00170   // Optional attributes that matter when <ind_analysis::is_estimation> is "yes".
00171   //
00172   // * mitr   
00173   // * is_restart = {yes, "no"}
00174   // * sig_digits = 3
00175   //
00176   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00177   myIndMitr   = 0;
00178   mySigDigits = 3;
00179 
00180   const XMLCh * xml_is_restart;
00181   if( ind_analysis->hasAttribute( XML.X_SIG_DIGITS ) )
00182     {
00183       xml_is_restart = ind_analysis->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_RESTART );
00184       myIsRestart = ( XMLString::equals( xml_is_restart, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00185     }
00186   if( myIsEstimate )
00187     {
00188       const XMLCh* xml_mitr;
00189       if( ind_analysis->hasAttribute( XML.X_MITR ) )
00190     {
00191       xml_mitr = ind_analysis->getAttribute( XML.X_MITR );
00192       if( !XMLString::textToBin( xml_mitr, myIndMitr ) )
00193         {
00194           char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];

00197             "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".",

00199           SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00200           throw e;
00201         }
00202     }
00203       const XMLCh* xml_sig_digits;
00204       if( ind_analysis->hasAttribute( XML.X_SIG_DIGITS ) )
00205     {
00206       xml_sig_digits = ind_analysis->getAttribute( XML.X_SIG_DIGITS );
00207       if( !XMLString::textToBin( xml_sig_digits, mySigDigits ) )
00208         {
00209           char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00210           snprintf( mess, 
00211             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00212             "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".", 
00213             XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS, XML.C_SIG_DIGITS, XMLString::transcode(xml_sig_digits) );
00214           SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00215           throw e;
00216         }
00217       if( !( mySigDigits > 0 && mySigDigits < 9 ) )
00218         {
00219           char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00220           snprintf( mess, 
00221             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00222             "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".  Valid values: (1-8).", 
00223             XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS, XML.C_SIG_DIGITS, mySigDigits );
00224           SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00225           throw e;
00226         }
00227       myIndEpsilon = pow( 10.0, -(mySigDigits + 1.0) );
00228     }
00229     }
00230   
00231   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00232   // Required elements
00233   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00234   // <data_labels>
00235   // <theta>
00236   // <omega>+
00237   DOMNodeList * data_labels_list = ind_analysis->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_DATA_LABELS );
00238   if( data_labels_list->getLength() > 1 )
00239     {
00240       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00241       snprintf( mess, 
00242         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00243         "Multiple <%s> elements found under <%s>.",

00245       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00246       throw e;
00247     }
00248   if( data_labels_list->getLength() < 1 )
00249     {
00250       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00251       snprintf( mess, 
00252         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00253         "Missing <%s> element under <%s>.",
00254         XML.C_DATA_LABELS, XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS );
00255       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00256       throw e;

00258   DOMElement * data_labels = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( data_labels_list->item(0) );
00259   {
00260 
00261     DOMNodeList * labels = data_labels->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_LABEL );
00262     int nLabels = labels->getLength();
00263     if( nLabels < 1 )
00264       {
00265         char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00266         snprintf( mess, 
00267           SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),

00271         throw e;
00272       }
00273     for( int i=0; i<nLabels; i++ )
00274       {
00275     DOMElement * xml_label = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( labels->item(i) );
00276     // <label> is an empty element
00277 
00278     // required attribute
00279     // * name
00280     if( !xml_label->hasAttribute( XML.X_NAME ) )
00281       {
00282             char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00283             snprintf( mess, 
00284               SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00285               "Missing <%s::%s> attribute.",
00286               XML.C_LABEL, XML.C_NAME );
00287             SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00288             throw e;
00289       }
00290     const XMLCh* xml_name = xml_label->getAttribute( XML.X_NAME );
00291     char * c_name = XMLString::transcode( xml_name );
00292 
00293     // optional attribute
00294     // * synonym
00295     const XMLCh* xml_synonym;
00296     char * c_synonym = NULL;
00297     if( xml_label->hasAttribute( XML.X_SYNONYM ) )
00298       {
00299         xml_synonym = xml_label->getAttribute( XML.X_SYNONYM );
00300         c_synonym = XMLString::transcode( xml_synonym );
00301       }
00302 
00303     Symbol * name = table->find( c_name );
00304 
00305     // "name" may not be one of the official data item labels.
00306     // For example, "DV" may be used as an official data label
00307     // in the data set (ie. dataML) but used as an alias
00308     // to "CP" so that "CP" appears as the item title in
00309     // the display table/scatterplot.
00310     // Check if this <label> has label::synonym attribute.
00311     // If it does, check if it exists in the symbol table.
00312     if( name == Symbol::empty() )
00313       {
00314         if( c_synonym == NULL )
00315           {
00316                 char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00317                 snprintf( mess, 
00318               SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00319               "\"%s\" is not found in the symbol table as either the name or the alias.", c_name );
00320                 SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_PROGRAMMER_ERR, mess, 
00321                                         __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00322                 throw e;
00323           }
00324         Symbol * synonym = table->find( c_synonym );
00325         if( synonym == Symbol::empty() )
00326           {
00327                 char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00328                 snprintf( mess, 
00329               SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00330               "\"%s\" is not found in the symbol table as either the name or the alias.", c_name );
00331                 SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, 
00332                                         __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00333                 throw e;
00334           }
00335         synonym->synonym = c_name;
00336       }
00337 
00338     else if( c_synonym != NULL )
00339       {
00340         // register the synonym to the symbol table
00341         name->synonym = c_synonym;
00342       }
00343     delete c_name;
00344     delete c_synonym;
00345       }
00346   }
00347

00441     if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_fixed ) != 0 )

00445     const XMLCh* xml_val = value->getFirstChild()->getNodeValue();

00536           "The number of <%s> elements under <%s> tag does not match with the <%s::%s> attribute value.",
00537           XML.C_VALUE, XML.C_UP, XML.C_THETA, XML.C_LENGTH );
00538     SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00539     throw e;
00540       }
00541     for( int i=0; i<myThetaLen; i++ )
00542       {
00543     char str_val[128];
00544     const XMLCh* xml_val = value_list->item(i)->getFirstChild()->getNodeValue();
00545     if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_val ) == 0 )
00546       strcpy( str_val, "0.0" );
00547     else
00548       {
00549         char * tmp_c_val = XMLString::transcode( xml_val );
00550         strcpy( str_val, tmp_c_val );
00551         delete tmp_c_val;
00552       }
00553     sym_theta->upper[0][i] = str_val;
00554       }
00555 
00556     // step values
00557     for( int i=0; i<myThetaLen; i++ )
00558       {
00559     double tmp_dbl = fabs( ( atof( sym_theta->upper[0][i].c_str() ) - atof( sym_theta->lower[0][i].c_str() ) ) ) / 1000.0;
00560     char tmp_char[256];
00561     snprintf( tmp_char, 256, "%f", tmp_dbl );
00562     sym_theta->step[0][i] = string( tmp_char );
00563       }
00564   }
00565 
00566   // OMEGA
00567   DOMNodeList * omega_list = ind_analysis->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_OMEGA );
00568   int nOmegaSpecs = omega_list->getLength();
00569   //if( nOmegaSpecs > 1 )
00570   //  {
00571   //    // v0.1 supports only one Omega specification
00572   //    char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00573   //    snprintf( mess, 
00574   //        SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00575   //        "Multiple <%s> elements found under <%s>.",
00576   //        XML.C_OMEGA, XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS );
00577   //   SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00578   //   throw e;
00579   //  }
00580   if( nOmegaSpecs < 1 )
00581     {
00582       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00583       snprintf( mess, 
00584         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00585         "Missing <%s> elements under <%s>.",
00586         XML.C_OMEGA, XML.C_IND_ANALYSIS );
00587       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00588       throw e;
00589     }
00590   myOmegaDim.resize( nOmegaSpecs );
00591   myOmegaOrder.resize( nOmegaSpecs );
00592   myOmegaStruct.resize( nOmegaSpecs );
00593   myOmegaSameAsPrev.resize( nOmegaSpecs );
00594 
00595   DOMElement * omega;
00596   for (int ii = 0; ii < nOmegaSpecs; ii++)    // loop through blocks
00597     {
00598     omega = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( omega_list->item(ii) );
00599   if( !omega->hasAttribute( XML.X_DIMENSION ) )
00600     {
00601       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00602       snprintf( mess, 
00603         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00604         "Missing <%s::%s> attribute.",
00605         XML.C_OMEGA, XML.C_DIMENSION );
00606       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00607       throw e;
00608     }
00609   const XMLCh* xml_omega_dim = omega->getAttribute( XML.X_DIMENSION );
00610   if( !XMLString::textToBin( xml_omega_dim, myOmegaDim[ii] ) )
00611     {
00612       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00613       snprintf( mess, 
00614         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00615         "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".", 
00616         XML.C_OMEGA, XML.C_DIMENSION, XMLString::transcode(xml_omega_dim) );
00617       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00618       throw e;
00619     }
00620   // SAME_AS_PREVIOUS  ---------------------------------------------
00621   if( omega->hasAttribute( XML.X_SAME_AS_PREVIOUS ) )
00622     {
00623       const XMLCh* xml_omega_sameAsPrev = omega->getAttribute( XML.X_SAME_AS_PREVIOUS );
00624       myOmegaSameAsPrev[ii] = (XMLString::equals( xml_omega_sameAsPrev, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00625     }
00626   // --------------------------------------------------------------
00627   if( !omega->hasAttribute( XML.X_STRUCT ) )
00628     {
00629       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00630       snprintf( mess, 
00631         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00632         "Missing <%s::%s> attribute.",
00633         XML.C_OMEGA, XML.C_STRUCT );
00634       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00635       throw e;
00636     }
00637   // In Individual analysis, Omega is diagonal only.
00638   const XMLCh* xml_omega_struct = omega->getAttribute( XML.X_STRUCT );
00639   if( !XMLString::equals( xml_omega_struct, XML.X_DIAGONAL ) )
00640     {
00641       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00642       snprintf( mess, 
00643         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00644         "For the individual analysis, Omega can be only diagonal.  %s is invalid.",
00645         XMLString::transcode( xml_omega_struct ) );
00646       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00647       throw e;
00648     }
00649 
00650   myOmegaStruct[ii] = Symbol::DIAGONAL;
00651   myOmegaOrder[ii] = myOmegaDim[ii];
00652   } // end of first "loop through blocks"
00653 
00654  Symbol * sym_omega = table->insertSymmetricMatrix( nonmem::OMEGA, myOmegaStruct, myOmegaDim, Symbol::SYSTEM, Symbol::READONLY );
00655  
00656   // Only get the rest of the Omega related values if this is not an
00657   // identifiability calculation.
00658   if( !myIsIdent )
00659   {
00660     //<in>
00661     DOMNodeList * omega_in_list = omega->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_IN );
00662     //if( omega_in_list->getLength() > 1 )
00663     //  {
00664     //  char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00665     //  snprintf( mess, 
00666     //        SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00667     //        "Multiple <%s> elements found under <%s>.",
00668     //    XML.C_IN, XML.C_OMEGA );
00669     //  SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00670     //  throw e;
00671     //  }
00672     if( omega_in_list->getLength() < 1 )
00673       {
00674     char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00675     snprintf( mess, 
00676           SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00677           "Missing <%s> element under <%s>.",
00678           XML.C_IN, XML.C_OMEGA );
00679     SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00680     throw e;
00681       }
00682 
00683    DOMElement * omega_in;
00684     for (int ii = 0; ii < nOmegaSpecs; ii++)    // loop through blocks (to get data values)
00685       {
00686 
00687     omega_in = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( omega_in_list->item(ii) );
00688 
00689     //
00690     // Omega specification contains the minimal representation of the matrix.
00691     //
00692     //     /                 \
00693       //     |  a11  a12  a13  |
00694       // A = |  a21  a22  a23  |
00695       //     |  a31  a32  a33  |
00696       //     \                 /
00697       //
00698       // For full, the list contains the LOWER half in the row major order.
00699       // For diagonal, only the diagonal elements.
00700       //
00701       // If A is full, the user-given list will contain elements in the following order:
00702       // A' = { a11, a21, a22, a31, a32, a33 }
00703       //
00704       // xxxPredModel's constructor expects the list containing elements of
00705       // the UPPER half in the row major order.
00706       //
00707       // Thus, A has to be reorganized and stored in an internal array in the following order:
00708       // A" = { a11, a21, a31, a22, a32, a33 }
00709       //
00710       char valueDefault[] = "0.0";
00711       DOMNodeList * value_list = omega_in->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_VALUE );
00712       if( myOmegaOrder[ii] != value_list->getLength() )
00713     {
00714       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00715       snprintf( mess,
00716             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00717            "The number of <%s> elements does not match with the <%s::%s> attribute value.", 
00718            XML.C_VALUE, XML.C_OMEGA, XML.C_LENGTH );
00719       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00720       throw e;
00721     }
00722       if( myOmegaStruct[ii] == Symbol::TRIANGLE )
00723     {
00724       // First construct a full n by n matrix.
00725       valarray<string> omega_in_full ( myOmegaDim[ii] * myOmegaDim[ii] );
00726       valarray<bool> omega_fix_full( myOmegaDim[ii] * myOmegaDim[ii] );
00727       for( int i=0, cnt=0; i<myOmegaDim[ii]; i++ )
00728         {
00729           for( int j=0; j<=i; j++, cnt++ )
00730         {
00731           char str_val[128];
00732           bool isFixed = false;
00733           DOMElement * value = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( value_list->item(cnt) );
00734           if( value->hasAttribute( XML.X_FIXED ) )
00735             {
00736               const XMLCh* xml_fixed = value->getAttribute( XML.X_FIXED );
00737               isFixed = (XMLString::equals( xml_fixed, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00738             }
00739           const XMLCh* xml_val = value->getFirstChild()->getNodeValue();
00740 
00741           if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_val ) == 0 )
00742             strcpy( str_val, valueDefault );
00743           else
00744             {
00745               char * tmp_c_val = XMLString::transcode( xml_val );
00746               strcpy( str_val, tmp_c_val );
00747               delete tmp_c_val;
00748             }
00749           //omega_in_full[ j + i*dim ] = a[cnt]; // filling a lower triangle element
00750           omega_in_full [ i + j*myOmegaDim[ii] ] = str_val; // filling a upper triangle element
00751           omega_fix_full[ i + j*myOmegaDim[ii] ] = isFixed;
00752         }
00753         }
00754       // Then, extract only the upper half in the row major order.
00755       for( int i=0, cnt=0; i<myOmegaDim[ii]; i++ )
00756         {
00757           for( int j=i; j<myOmegaDim[ii]; j++, cnt++ )
00758         {
00759           sym_omega->initial[ii][cnt] = omega_in_full [ j + i * myOmegaDim[ii] ];
00760           sym_omega->fixed  [ii][cnt] = omega_fix_full[ j + i * myOmegaDim[ii] ];
00761         }
00762         }
00763     }
00764       else // diagonal case
00765     {
00766       for( int i=0; i<myOmegaDim[ii]; i++ )
00767         {
00768           char str_val[128];
00769           bool isFixed = false;
00770           DOMElement * value = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( value_list->item(i) );
00771           if( value->hasAttribute( XML.X_FIXED ) )
00772         {
00773           const XMLCh* xml_fixed = value->getAttribute( XML.X_FIXED );
00774           isFixed = (XMLString::equals( xml_fixed, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00775         }
00776           const XMLCh* xml_val = value->getFirstChild()->getNodeValue();
00777 
00778           if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_val ) == 0 )
00779         strcpy( str_val, valueDefault );
00780           else
00781         {
00782           char * tmp_c_val = XMLString::transcode( xml_val );
00783           strcpy( str_val, tmp_c_val );
00784           delete tmp_c_val;
00785         }
00786           sym_omega->initial[ii][i] = str_val;
00787           sym_omega->fixed[ii][i]   = isFixed;
00788         }
00789     }
00790       } // end block omega loop
00791   }
00792 
00793   // ETA
00794   // Eta plays the same role as EPS as in the population analysis.
00795   // Variance of data?
00796   char etaDefault[] = "0.0";
00797   //  myEtaLen = myOmegaOrder;
00798   int sumOmegaDim = 0;
00799   if ( nOmegaSpecs > 1 )   //block diag case
00800     {
00801       for (int nBlk = 0; nBlk < nOmegaSpecs; nBlk) 
00802     {
00803       sumOmegaDim += myOmegaDim[nBlk];
00804     }
00805     }
00806   else
00807     {
00808       sumOmegaDim = myOmegaDim[0];
00809     }
00810   myEtaLen = sumOmegaDim;
00811   //myEtaLen = myOmegaDim;
00812   Symbol * sym_eta = table->insertVector( nonmem::ETA, myEtaLen, Symbol::SYSTEM, Symbol::READONLY );
00813   for( int i=0; i<myEtaLen; i++ ) sym_eta->initial[0][i] = etaDefault;
00814   sym_eta->fixed[0] = false;
00815 
00816   
00817   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00818   // Optional elements
00819   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00820   // <description>  --- ignore!
00821   // <ind_stat>
00822   // <pop_stat>
00823   DOMNodeList * descriptions = ind_analysis->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_DESCRIPTION );
00824   myDescription = new char[ 128 ];
00825   strcpy( myDescription, "--- This file is generated by SPK Compiler ---" );
00826 
00827   if( descriptions->getLength() > 0 )
00828     {
00829       const XMLCh* description = descriptions->item(0)->getFirstChild()->getNodeValue();
00830       if( XMLString::stringLen( description ) > 0 )
00831     {
00832       delete [] myDescription;
00833       myDescription = XMLString::transcode( description );
00834     }
00835     }
00836 
00837   DOMNodeList * ind_stat_list = ind_analysis->getElementsByTagName( XML.X_IND_STAT );
00838 
00839   // Statistics computation can be done only when the parameter estimation
00840   // is requested.
00841   if( ind_stat_list->getLength() > 0 && myIsEstimate )
00842     {
00843       if( ind_stat_list->getLength() > 1 )
00844     {
00845       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00846       snprintf( mess, 
00847             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00848             "Multiple <%s> elements found.",
00849             XML.C_IND_STAT );
00850       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00851       throw e;
00852     }
00853       if( ind_stat_list->getLength() < 1 )
00854     {
00855       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00856       snprintf( mess, 
00857             SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00858             "Missing <%s> element.",
00859             XML.C_IND_STAT );
00860       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00861       throw e;
00862     }
00863       DOMElement * ind_stat = dynamic_cast<DOMElement*>( ind_stat_list->item(0) );
00864       const XMLCh* xml_stderr = ind_stat->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_ERR_OUT );
00865       const XMLCh* cov_form = XML.X_COV_H;
00866       if( ind_stat->hasAttribute( XML.X_COVARIANCE_FORM ) )
00867     cov_form = ind_stat->getAttribute( XML.X_COVARIANCE_FORM );
00868       if( XMLString::equals( cov_form, XML.X_COV_S ) )
00869     myCovForm = "S";
00870       else if( XMLString::equals( cov_form, XML.X_COV_RSR ) )
00871     myCovForm = "RSR";
00872       else if( XMLString::equals( cov_form, XML.X_COV_R ) )
00873     myCovForm = "R";
00874       else if( XMLString::equals( cov_form, XML.X_COV_HSH ) )
00875     myCovForm = "HSH";
00876       else if( XMLString::equals( cov_form, XML.X_COV_H ) )
00877     myCovForm = "H";
00878       else
00879     {
00880       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00881       snprintf( mess, 
00882              SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00883              "Invalid <%s::%s> attribute value: \"%s\".", 
00884              XML.C_IND_STAT, XML.C_COVARIANCE_FORM, XMLString::transcode( cov_form )  );
00885       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_SOURCEML_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00886       throw e;
00887     }
00888       if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_stderr ) > 0 )
00889     {
00890       myIsStderr = (XMLString::equals( xml_stderr, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00891     }
00892       const XMLCh* xml_correlation = ind_stat->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_CORR_OUT );
00893       if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_correlation ) > 0 )
00894     {
00895       myIsCorrelation = (XMLString::equals( xml_correlation, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00896     }
00897       const XMLCh* xml_cov = ind_stat->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_COV_OUT );
00898       if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_cov ) > 0 )
00899     {
00900       myIsCov = (XMLString::equals( xml_cov, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00901     }
00902       const XMLCh* xml_inv_cov = ind_stat->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_INV_COV_OUT );
00903       if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_inv_cov ) > 0 )
00904     {
00905       myIsInvCov = (XMLString::equals( xml_inv_cov, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00906     }
00907       const XMLCh* xml_conf = ind_stat->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_CONF_OUT );
00908       if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_conf ) > 0 )
00909     {
00910       myIsConfidence = (XMLString::equals( xml_conf, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00911     }
00912       const XMLCh* xml_coef = ind_stat->getAttribute( XML.X_IS_COEF_OUT );
00913       if( XMLString::stringLen( xml_coef ) > 0 )
00914     {
00915       myIsCoefficient = (XMLString::equals( xml_coef, XML.X_YES )? true : false );
00916     }
00917     }
00918   else
00919     {
00920       myIsStat = false;
00921       myIsStderr = false;
00922       myIsCorrelation = false;
00923       myIsCov = false;
00924       myIsInvCov = false;
00925       myIsConfidence = false;
00926       myIsCoefficient = false;
00927     }
00928 
00929   myIsStat = myIsStderr 
00930     || myIsCorrelation 
00931     || myIsCov 
00932     || myIsInvCov 
00933     || myIsConfidence 
00934     || myIsCoefficient;
00935 
00936   myIndTraceLevel = 1;
00937   myPopTraceLevel = 1;
00938 
00939 
00940   return;
00941 }
